column4: as far as increasing my swap partition, i don't know if i feel comfortable booting from live cd, increasing partition and interupting the install.  is there a way to disable the partition, increase the size, then re enable?
why do you wnat to increase swap?
ok so you have to shutdown, boot into livecd, run gparted, and resize your swap partition.
run without making changes.  it just runs off the cd
you can't resize your partitions while they are active.  that is why you boot from livecd
how did you get into gparted ?
maybe can you resize the other partition not swap, then delete the swap, then create a new swap partition that is larger ?
sorry i just noticed i was mispelling your name.  can't resize/move any partition or drive off the live cd.
if you boot from the livecd, you can run gparted, and resize the partitions....
try opening a terminal and type gksu gparted
would the fact that the partitions have key icons next to them have anything to do with not being able to do anything to them even with live cd?
lol is there an "unlcok" button on your screen
are you sure?  look harder.   you need to hit the unlock button
don't see one.  are talking in live cd i should see an unlock feature?
i tried again with live cd.  and it gives me the option to resize the main partition.  but sda2 and sda5 nothing.
